definition: big/huge/large/major/great/wide/deep/older (than)/oldest/eldest/greatly/very much/(dialect) father/father's elder or younger brother

prefix used before the surname of a person or a numeral indicating the order of birth of the children in a family or to indicate affection or familiarity/old (of people)/venerable (person)/experienced/of long standing/always/all the time/of the past/very/outdated/(of meat etc) tough
far/distant/remote/(intensifier in a comparison) by far/much (lower etc)

sentences.english: But she had come this far, she wasn't going to back out now.
sentences.chinese: 不過既然大老遠跑來，絕不會此刻罷手。

sentences.english: Take airplane and greatly and from afar bring to China to this niggard.
sentences.chinese: 坐着飛機大老遠的把這個吝嗇鬼送到中國。

sentences.english: You dragged me all the way out here to watch a war movie?
sentences.chinese: 你大老遠拖我到這裏來看戰爭片？

sentences.english: I dont know why anyone would want to use their money visiting a zoo so far away.
sentences.chinese: 我不知道爲什麼會有人會花錢跑大老遠參觀動物園。

sentences.english: Thanks for coming all the way over here.
sentences.chinese: 謝謝你大老遠的來到這兒。

sentences.english: They came all the way from Brazil.
sentences.chinese: 他們大老遠的從巴西來。

sentences.english: I knew I was on the right move to come so far away from China.
sentences.chinese: 我知道大老遠從中國跑到這裏來，算是來對了。

sentences.english: I came all this way here to get stuck on the wrong and of this rock pile?
sentences.chinese: 我跑了這麼大老遠，就這樣被困在石頭堆裏？

sentences.english: "What made you decide to move here all the way from the North-East?" I asked.
sentences.chinese: “怎麼想到要大老遠地從東北搬到這裏來？”我問。

sentences.english: You came all the way from to give me a lecture?
sentences.chinese: 你大老遠從倫敦來到這裏就爲了教訓我？

sentences.english: Thank you for coming to my home away from home.
sentences.chinese: 感謝你大老遠地到我這來做客。
